intro: Couepia pauciflora, commonly known as the few-flowered couepia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Couepia pauciflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along streambanks.
